column4: Update Manager gives a "Requires installation f untrusted packages" error fr some recommended updates. It doesn't give me any options to fix it.
of*
details: dbus dbus-x11 libdbus-1-3 libfreetype6 libpng12-0 libsndfile1 update-manager update-manager-core
I have checked all sources in settings
can you give the output of:  sudo apt-get update; lsb_release -a
use a pastebin to hold the output so you don't scrol the channel :)
be sure that software centre etc is closed
http://paste.ubuntu.com/654221/
I remember having this error before, but I think i fixed it by changing from UAE's server to main server
worth a try
if its still making the same noise, pastebin the text I requested and we can fix
I already did, http://paste.ubuntu.com/654221/
sorry, let me review
sudo apt-key adv --recv-key --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com 40976EAF437D05B5
I executed that line, output included "gpg: key 437D05B5: "Ubuntu Archive Automatic Signing Key <ftpmaster@ubuntu.com>" not changed"
I get the same error when updating
here's the full output http://paste.ubuntu.com/654229/
try: sudo apt-get -o Acquire::http::No-Cache=True -o Acquire::BrokenProxy=true update
the output is similar to 'sudo apt-get update', it ends with "The following signatures were invalid: BADSIG 40976EAF437D05B5 Ubuntu Archive Automatic Signing Key <ftpmaster@ubuntu.com>"
after I executed that last command, I see more updates in the update manager
in settings, there's a tab for 'Authentication' with an option to 'Import Key FIle...' , can I not download the key file instead of doing it from command lin?
